meanings.definition: A large tropical fruit with a spiky outer skin and sweet yellow flesh.
meanings.sent1: I tried a delicious jackfruit smoothie for the first time.
meanings.sent2: The market was selling fresh jackfruit at a reasonable price.
meanings.sent3: When the jackfruit fell from the tree, it bounced like a rubber ball.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as contagious as the sweet aroma of a ripe jackfruit.
meanings.sent5: The jackfruit's vibrant yellow color stood out among the green leaves.

meanings.sent1: The jackfruit tree in our backyard provides shade during hot summer days.
meanings.sent2: We planted a new jackfruit tree next to the mango tree.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels seemed to have a party on the jackfruit tree last night.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the jackfruit tree reached towards the sky like outstretched arms.
meanings.sent5: The leaves of the jackfruit tree rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: The wood of the jackfruit tree.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter crafted a beautiful table from jackfruit wood.
meanings.sent2: The aroma of freshly cut jackfruit wood filled the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The jackfruit wood was so sturdy that it could withstand any weather.
meanings.sent4: The furniture made from jackfruit wood had a unique, natural charm.
meanings.sent5: The rich color of the jackfruit wood added warmth to the room.
